lpspline.optimizer package

Submodules

lpspline.optimizer.regressor module

class lpspline.optimizer.regressor.LpRegressor(splines: Spline | List[Spline])[source]

Bases: object

LpRegressor class to fit linear spline models using convex optimization.

fit(X: polars.DataFrame, y: polars.Series) → None[source]

Fit the additive model to the data.

Minimizes the L2 norm of the difference between the sum of spline terms and the target y. ||Sum(Spline_i(X)) - y||_2

Parameters:

  • X – Input DataFrame containing the features.

  • y – Target Series.

Raises:

ValueError – If no splines are provided or if required columns are missing.

get_spline(tag: str) → Spline[source]

Returns the spline with the given tag.

predict(X: polars.DataFrame, return_components: bool = False) → numpy.ndarray[source]

Predict target values for new data.

Parameters:

  • X – Input DataFrame.

  • return_components – If True, returns a matrix where each column corresponds to a spline’s output.

Returns:

Numpy array of predictions. If return_components is True, shape (n_samples, n_splines). Else, shape (n_samples,).

Raises:

ValueError – If required columns are missing.

Print a formatted summary of the fitted model.
